comment.author: 95027075@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Possibly a tethered balloon, or a crane. Otherwise someone has built a lot of scaffolding to get a single photo.

Look at the total lack of safety gear.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/kjbeath] There was a scaffolding tower with a crane on top - 1917 - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... 1918 - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... Or was it from a low-flying barnstorming biplane ?

comment.author: 95027075@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks. Now that I think of it, they needed something to get the blocks up. Very different from todays cranes.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/kjbeath] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02]Did you notice the rotunda in the 1917 picture? It's still there! I wonder when its centenary is or was? Might be worth a celebration!

comment._content:

comment.author: 56925482@N07
comment._content: re : lack of safety gear, the man on the right is leaning on his left hand  with all his weight. Just as well the tiles / slate didn't slip ! at least the other two men in the centre are holding on to something.

comment.author: 95027075@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/56925482@N07] They are about 15cm thick sandstone with a fairly solid piece of rod through them, so they aren't going anywhere.

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content: i liked the look of the sandstone cupola. but recently clad in copper due to erosion. still looks good. great pic

comment._content: Should this be correctly named Sydney Central tower to differentiate the three railway stations?
